instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (purchased lot of boards on eBay) MDM is present on some of them.
threads.message:
I purchased a lot of <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B boards on eBay.  12 of them.  I have fixed 11 of them so far but a few of them have MDM on them.  I have found this out when trying to load the OS on my test drive.  You only find out near the end of the process which takes forever!

This is my first encounter with MDM.  
I want to be able to sell these boards to users who need board replacements.  

If I flash the bios with the customer's Serial number and do a NVRAM reset will MDM still be present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (purchased lot of boards on eBay) MDM is present on some of them.
threads.message:
Just try; if you have Medusa, is question of minutes.
Don't forget to fix checksum and clean ME region.
